e972ced1-1636-4727-958a-34e76320aeea.description: The CCMP™ is a globally recognized credential established by ACMP for professionals to demonstrate their commitment to leading the way change works. The CCMP™ was developed based on ACMP’s industry-leading Standard for Change Management© ("Standard”) that defines best practices in change management. The CCMP™ is a way for professionals to demonstrate their investment in ongoing development while successfully applying their experience to respond to a breadth of change management situations.
e972ced1-1636-4727-958a-34e76320aeea.name: Certified Change Management Professional™ (CCMP™)

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Change Management Professionals®

alignments.name: Standard for Change Management
alignments.description: A collection of generally accepted change management practices and one of the foundational elements in advancing the change management profession and discipline. Released in 2014, it provides the foundation for the CCMP™ credential, the Qualified Education Provider™ (QEP) Program, and empowers change practitioners to lead the way change works.

badge_template_activities.title: A 4-year degree (or international equivalent) and 3 years (4200 hours) of change management experience OR Secondary education (high school or international equivalent) and 5 years (7000 hours) of change management experience.

Completion of 21 hours of instructor-led change management training in the past seven years. The QEP Registry provides a listing of courses that align to the Standard for Change Management©, but you may also take qualifying courses that are not listed on the registry.

The application guides you through the entry of your education, experience and training and requires you to complete 3 out of 5 essay questions (maximum of 500 words each) demonstrating your change management experience. You must sign a Statement of Understanding declaring all of your information is truthful, and that you will abide by ACMP's Code of Ethics. Application fee of $745 (ACMP members pay only $595) paid upon submission.
3 hours, 150 multiple choice question exam that must be completed in the year after application approval; may retake the exam up to two additional times for a fee within the one-year window.

During each three-year period, certificants must complete 60 Professional Development Units (PDUs) and record them in ACMP's online system. Each PDU corresponds to one hour spent on an activity (with the exception of experience) and requires supporting evidence of completion. Work experience entries require the upload of a completed Employment Verification Form, signed by an employer representative. Keep all receipts and related documentation to validate your renewal application.
